Class DelegatedRegime

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.DelegatedRegime
All Implemented Interfaces:
HyperparameterConfigurable, Regime
Direct Known Subclasses:
DumpNodesRegime, EpochRegime, MiniBatchRegime, ObjectiveReportingRegime
@Decorator public abstract class DelegatedRegime extends Object implements Regime, HyperparameterConfigurable
An abstract Regime implementation that delegates all training to another Regime.

This class provides the common base for regime decorators such as BatchRegime, OnlineRegime, or reporting regimes. Subclasses can override Regime.train(E, net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet<N>, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction<N>, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer<? super E, N>) to add cross-cutting behavior (logging, early stopping, etc.) while still forwarding the actual training call to the delegated regime.

Default behavior

  • If a delegate regime is provided in the constructor, all calls are forwarded to it.
  • If no delegate is provided (null), a default inline regime is created that simply invokes Optimizer.optimize(net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.TrainableFunction, DataSet, ObjectiveFunction, int) once on the entire dataset, i.e. a single batch update.

  • Field Details

    • regime

      protected final Regime regime
      The regime that receives all delegated training calls. Guaranteed to be non-null: if no delegate is provided, a default batch regime is created internally.

  • Constructor Details

    • DelegatedRegime

      protected DelegatedRegime(Regime regime)
      Creates a new delegated regime.
      Parameters:
      regime - the regime to delegate to; if null, a default regime is used that trains once on the full dataset via the given Optimizer.

  • Method Details

    • getDelegatedRegime

      public Regime getDelegatedRegime()
      Returns the underlying delegated regime.
      Returns:
      the non-null delegate regime, either the one passed in the constructor or the default batch regime

    • hasHyperparameter

      public boolean hasHyperparameter(String name)
      Specified by:
      hasHyperparameter in interface HyperparameterConfigurable

    • getHyperparameters

      public Map<String,Object> getHyperparameters()
      Returns a snapshot of all current hyperparameters.

      The returned map should contain stable, human-readable keys (such as "learningRate" or "momentum") mapped to their current values. Implementations are encouraged to return a defensive copy so that external modifications do not affect the internal state.

      Specified by:
      getHyperparameters in interface HyperparameterConfigurable
      Returns:
      an immutable or defensive copy of the current hyperparameters

    • setHyperparameter

      Updates a single hyperparameter by name.
      Specified by:
      setHyperparameter in interface HyperparameterConfigurable
      Parameters:
      name - the hyperparameter name
      value - the new hyperparameter value
